lab.name: HCIS Lab
lab.institution: National Yang Ming Chiao Tung University
lab.philosophy: We establish Human-Centered Physical AI, an interdisciplinary field that unifies perception, learning, embodiment, and multi-agent physical and virtual interaction to advance the design, standardization, evaluation, and real-world deployment of Physical AI systems that are safe, reliable, and responsive to human needs — enhancing safety, autonomy, trust, and quality of life.

pillars.name: Perception
pillars.description: Computer Vision, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence

researchAreas.name: Intelligent Driving Systems
researchAreas.description: Developing intelligent systems that understand driving scenes, assess risks, and enable safer autonomous driving through human-centric design principles.

researchAreas.name: Assistive Robotics
researchAreas.description: Creating robots that assist humans in daily tasks through intelligent perception, manipulation, and human-robot interaction.

featuredResearch.title: SCONE
featuredResearch.subtitle: A Food Scooping Robot Learning Framework with Active Perception
featuredResearch.description: A behavior cloning framework using kinesthetic teaching and active perception for food acquisition tasks.

featuredResearch.title: GRITS
featuredResearch.subtitle: A Spillage-Aware Guided Diffusion Policy for Robot Food Scooping Tasks
featuredResearch.description: A guided diffusion policy that effectively avoids risky spillage scenarios and generalizes to unseen food items with varying quantities and distributions.
featuredResearch.authors: Tai, Yang, Yu, Chao, and Chen

talentPrograms.title: Fun AI Camp
talentPrograms.description: Hands-on AI and robotics workshops introducing students to Physical AI concepts through interactive projects.

talentPrograms.title: WildBot Competition
talentPrograms.description: A robotics competition challenging teams to build autonomous mobile manipulation systems in real-world scenarios.

talentPrograms.title: Cross-University Co-Teaching
talentPrograms.description: Collaborative teaching program bringing together faculty and students from multiple universities for robot learning.

talentPrograms.title: Physical AI @ NYCU CS
talentPrograms.description: Design, prototype, and present a Physical AI solution that demonstrates integration of sensing, reasoning, and action.
